text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Three managers at the university of Zambia have been arrested in connection with the theft of computers.
- A strike by Zambian railway workers is to resume on Monday.
- Zambia and Rwanda have agreed to sign an extradition pact to facilitate the indictment and trial of people suspected of hiding in Zambia to evade prosecution for the 1994 genocide.
- Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines management and the Mineworkers Union of Zambia were scheduled to meet on Tuesday to discuss privatisation and the future of mines.
- Over 130 criminal charges have been brought against former directors and managers of the defunct Meridien BIAO Bank Zambia and they will appear in court in Lusaka on August 12.
- Zambia's reserve food agency said the country's maize stocks would last for about three months.
